file_content.text: Don't move! None of you move!
Don't move, Sith! Not one move!
Stay back! Not one move.
Careful, ground team.
Listen to their voices--they cannot defeat you, but they stand defiant.
You're pathetic.
We're wasting time. [Disarm them]
I've come for Pollus Avesta. Where is he?
I need to talk to your leader.
I'm not here to fight. Your droids attacked first, but I'll lay down my weapons.
It's okay--I surrender.
Where is your leader?
I'm Pollus Avesta. You didn't have to do that.
I received your message. You freed the settlements, and I'm grateful. But why would the Empire get involved at all?
Right here.
Not necessary--I trust you could kill me bare-handed. I'm Pollus Avesta.
The Empire doesn't care about Makeb, but our intelligence is clear: The Hutt Cartel is a growing threat and must be stopped.
We're here to fight Hutts.
No one should be forced to work in Hutt mines and die a slave. The Empire is sympathetic to your cause.
Makeb's people deserve better.
You don't need to know why the Empire is interested in Makeb. We're here, and nothing we do will harm the planet or its citizens.
Our reasons don't affect you.
Same reason the Republic's here, then.
That's enough.
We've given you an opportunity to fight back. You need to take it and organize a planet-wide attack.
You're not serious.
I represent the Dark Council, and I have come to this world personally to stop the Hutt Cartel.
The Hutts threaten my Empire.
The Emperor does not tolerate his enemies' ambitions. The Hutt Cartel has proven itself an enemy.
The Hutts are our foes.
My employers don't share their reasons. But if I were on the Dark Council, I'd be worried about Hutt expansion.
My guess is the Hutts.
That's a lot to claim.
And what if we say no?
I make a call, and within the hour I receive a record of every message you've ever sent.
I could always blackmail you.
If you say no, we walk away and don't speak again. Simple enough.
That's your right.
The next time hovertanks fire on your cities, there will be no one to stop them.
The Empire withdraws support.
I don't care what you say. I don't call the shots.
Not my problem.
You won't say no. You want to fight the Hutts.
[Force Persuade] You will agree.
You will rot here and be forgotten.
Refuse and die.
Within six hours, I have monitors on your known associates. I'm sure something I find will convince you.
Then again, why would I say no? I want to fight the Hutts.
Fair enough. But I'll need to talk to the others. I can't make this decision for the whole planet.
I'll need to talk to my associates first, though. I can't make this decision for the whole planet.
Right. Well. It's not my decision to make, regardless. Let me talk to the other leaders in the resistance.
I think that's a good sign.
Once Pollus is on board, get out, and I can tip off the Regulator mercenaries--let them know Pollus's attack is coming. Maximize the blood and fury.
We don't want the Hutts to win, but we need to draw the fight out as long as possible. I thought you'd like it.
What?
Balance everything out so the Hutts and rebels kill one another. Is that it?
You want to play both sides...
Tipping off the Regulators was not part of the plan.
I never ordered that.
Give the Regulators information on their foes, and we can draw out this fight as long as possible. Well done.
Clever work.
These rebels battle for their people against unthinkable odds. They deserve our admiration.
It's done.
Within twelve hours, we'll coordinate raids on the Regulator bases and Hutt palaces. But we're still outmatched--stay and help us plan.
I have other business. But when the fighting starts, I'll be there.
[Lie] I'll join you later.
Show me your equipment and your team. There's a lot to prepare and not much time.
Anything I can do, I will.
I have so much to offer you. Things you haven't considered. Would you say no forever?
[Flirt] I can tempt you somehow.
Fascinating points. I'll bite.
Thank you.
Take your teams here, and here. Understood?
Won't be easy.
We won't do better, either.
We should get ready, and you should get going. Not sure I should say it to the Empire, but... thank you.
Then we'll see you on the battlefield.
I have what I need. Do I tell the Regulators or not?
Set it up, but make sure the mercenaries don't know about our involvement.
Do it carefully.
Tell them, but I don't want a bloodbath. We may be using them, but the rebels deserve better.
Try to keep casualties low.
Let the rebels and the mercenaries fight their own battles from here on out.
We're not getting involved.
As you wish. We'll await you at the gravity hook.
It'll be an anonymous tip asking for credits in return. Should work out.
We'll await you at the gravity hook. Fighting'll start soon.
Good luck. And thank you.
I guess you made your call.
Stay where you are.
